session_summary: Session cleanup complete: passdown updated, final devlog posted to Discord, Swarm Brain entry captured, and a session_cleanup_helper tool added. Core architecture/design validations remain green (584/584 tests across cycles). WordPress deploy for FreeRideInvestor + Prismblossom still pending timing window with Agent-1; Monitoring domain SSOT remains open.

high: Deploy FreeRideInvestor + Prismblossom (manual WordPress/SFTP): confirm window with Agent-1, backup, upload 4 FRI + 1 PB file, flush cache, verify assets; if blocked, log blocker and propose times.
Complete Monitoring Domain SSOT (Phase 6A) and increase BaseManager adoption (small, reversible changes).
Advance SSOT tagging beyond 39% coverage (focus core + infra); tag 5–10 files and log paths. Use stall guard mindset: short sprints, log outcomes/blockers.
medium: Verify factory shim removal plan after confirming zero usage
Monitor for deployment regressions post-WordPress push
Use session_cleanup_helper to pre-seed passdown/devlog/Swarm Brain drafts next cycle

Monitoring domain SSOT pending design finalization
notes: Deployment ready: 4 FreeRideInvestor CSS/PHP updates + 1 Prismblossom CSS expansion; manual WordPress/SFTP required. Steps: backup → upload → cache flush → verify assets (status+size/hash) → rollback if needed.
Factory legacy files now shims with deprecation warnings to enforce SSOT usage.
tools_created: Stall Resumer Guard (is_resumer_prompt, is_meaningful_progress) for autonomous stall recovery
session_cleanup_helper (template generator for passdown/devlog/Swarm Brain entries)
lessons_learned: Maintain backward-compatible shims while enforcing SSOT to de-risk deletion.
Manual WordPress deploys require confirmed window and cache checks; prep checklists ahead of time.
Stall guards with content checks reduce false positives and keep execution moving.
Automating session cleanup templates reduces stall risk and keeps evidence consistent.
